Experience Business Analyst, CEO Office Barclays October 2014  – Present (11 months) Nairobi, Kenya Under Managing Director's office to support Chief of Staff/Managing Director to drive the most critical strategic agenda at Barclays Bank of Kenya (Established since 1916, 3,800 employees, 120 branches) 
 
• Introduced open innovation concept to Kenya business, initiated senior executives engagement with the central / regional team and conceptualized Rise Nairobi proposition, resulting in revisiting and approving the business case  
 
• Led the launch of Barclays Africa Supply Chain Challenge and implemented an outreach strategy to engage local entrepreneurs communities, resulting in most applications from Kenya within the first 3 weeks 
 
• Developed a short-term open innovation plan including key initiatives to solve 2 business challenges and gained MD’s approval for £145K to drive at least £482K savings from an agile product development process in 2015 
 
• Recommended firm-wide travel cost saving initiatives and led cross-functional teams (Finance, Procurement and Operations) to drive £640K savings annually 
 
• Proposed a new engagement plan for senior leadership in strategic planning to be approved by the managing director and implemented 
 
• Co-led the first ever Chinese networking event for Barclays with event concept design, agency selection, digital media promotion and outreached Chinese prospects to result in 154 participants 
 
• Supported relationship directors to originate 5 leads and on-boarded Kilimall International (No. 2 E-commerce platform in Kenya) for corporate account and Barclaycard online payment solution 
 
• Initiated templates of weekly strategy initiative tracker, quarterly sales performance review and strategic project reporting for country management team of 11 executive directors 
 
• Developed executive presentations for the MD/Chief of Staff to be used at all internal and external meetings, inlcuding board of director’s meeting, external investor day and quarterly town hall meeting with senior executives Business Analyst Intern Deutsche Post DHL Inhouse Consulting July 2014  –  September 2014  (3 months) Bonn Area, Germany DPDHL Inhouse Consulting is the strategy and management consultancy serving all companies of Deutsche Post DHL. 
 
• Developed the global organization restructuring plan to save potentially 8% operational cost for the global Finance-related department 
 
• Assisted the preparation of 2 strategic initiative plan to be approved by the global CFO of DP DHL 
 
• Conceptualized a proposal of Software-as-a-service (SaaS) center for the global head of IT-related department Chief of Staff Taifong Company LTD October 2013  –  June 2014  (9 months) Taipei City, Taiwan E-commerce Start-up based in Taiwan with NTD 130 million revenue in 2013 
 
• Formulated strategic partnerships to bring in NTD 120,000 revenues, three project alliances, and one investor 
 
• Developed and executed firm-wide mobile E-commerce strategy to bring in NTD 15,000 revenues in two weeks 
 
• Led an organization transformation project by analyzing current organization structure, workflow and talent quality, resulted in acquiring 4 qualified full-time employees in two weeks Business Analyst beBit October 2012  –  September 2013  (1 year) Tokyo, Japan / Taipei, Taiwan beBit is the No. 1 digital strategy consulting firm from Tokyo, Japan, devoted to develop the client-centric world based on the observation of customer's behavior and psychology. 
 
• First intern in Taipei office and received an offer after working for one month to become No.3 employee 
 
• Performed a landscape analysis of E-commerce industry in China to deliver an industry white paper, presented in the Japanese B2B marketing seminar to acquire 5 potential leads 
 
• Delivered 3 consulting reports to identify potential issues on a wellness online store for a top Japanese company in beverage and pharmacy industry by analyzing data in the size of 1,000  
 
• Secured 50% future consulting projects in Greater China by developing 10 customized pitch materials (Eslite, CommonWealth, Cathay Holdings, TrendMicro, Taiwantrade and etc.) and conducted follow-up activities Business Analyst Intern Google July 2012  –  October 2012  (4 months) Taipei, Taiwan • First intern of large customer sales department in Taipei office, selected out of nearly 5,000 candidates 
 
• Advised upselling strategies to senior managers by researching and synthesizing historical financial performance and strategy outlook of clients and leads, including ASUS, Acer, HTC, SONY, China Airline and Eva Air 
 
• Co-authored a CEO level pitch for Taiwan top airline company, resulting in acquiring more than 1M sales revenue 
 
• Analyzed Taiwan top 20,000 search queries to help monetize Google search revenue in Taiwan market President, National Office AIESEC June 2011  –  July 2012  (1 year 2 months) Taipei, Taiwan • Led 8 full-time function directors (7 Taiwanese and 1 Pilipino) to direct 15 local offices with 1,200-membership body to provide 1,000 international internship (40% YoY growth) and 300 leadership development (50% YoY growth) experiences to Taiwanese youth market.  
 
• Achieved YoY 10% growth in profit by performing past internal organizational performance data analysis for business intelligence in supporting day-to-day decision making on growth strategies, product development, market focus, organizational structure. 
 
• Increased YoY 50% growth on product sales by implementing NPS (Net Promoter Score) system to reengineer product quality controlling system to improve product marketing and development strategy. 
 
• Led a global project with members from 10 different countries/territories (Singapore, Denmark, Egypt, Bulgaria, Serbia, Greece, Hungary, Mozambique, Spain and Venezuela) to develop and streamline global conference operational process to minimize organizational financial and branding risks. 
 
• Represented AIESEC in Taiwan globally to participate 6 international events (Mexico, Kenya, The Philippines, China, Hungary, Japan) and networked with more than 1,000 young people, 10 business partners around the world. 
 
• Recognized as the most innovative entity among 110 counties/territories by developing and implementing a social innovation competition to engage more than 100,000 youths in Taiwan virtually and physically. 
 
• Developed and managed national consultancy cycle based on operational needs and one-year incentive system to transform organizational culture to be data-driven, innovative, and customer-oriented. President, Local Office of National Cheng Chi University AIESEC July 2010  –  June 2011  (1 year) Taipei, Taiwan • Led 8 part-time function directors to manage over 100-membership body (139% YoY growth) to reach the highest, 115% YoY growth, on organizational performance. 
 
• Reduced operational cost by reengineering cost analysis, cost planning, and project management system to achieve 1000% YoY growth in profit from 20,000 to 200,000. 
 
• Increased YoY 100% product sales by driving market segmentation strategies and PR events to engage 500 people in total. Summary I'm a passionate young professional offering a powerful blend of business leadership and an intuitive understanding of technology.  
 
One example of this is Dennis Tech, LLC a Mobile Application development firm that I founded in 2009. Dennis Tech has generated over 1M+ application downloads for apps developed for clients across the US. We have designed and developed mobile applications that have reached the #1 most popular spot in their categories on the Apple App Store and Palm App Marketplace.  
 
Another example of my leadership experience is my role as President of Bitwise Fellows. I developed a team of 10 highly talented and motivated high school students who created web solutions and consulted startups, small businesses and notable non-for-profit organizations on web strategy. My team was able to take on engagements much larger than before, and I grew our revenue by over 300% 
 
I'm currently pursuing a B.S in Business at the Kelley School of Business @ Indiana University Bloomington -- Major: Entrepreneurship and Corporate Innovation.
